body_html: afaik not much has changed from the user's pov as of yet. You can still call it in the usual way tensorboard --logdir=[..]. I think it's more for ease of development and open-sourcing etc. It means it's its own package now although I believe that it's installed as a dependency of tensorflow so for the user there isn't a huge change. You can point your TB issues and suggestions to the team at tensorflow/tensorboard :)

body: afaik not much has changed from the user's pov as of yet. You can still call it in the usual way `tensorboard --logdir=[..]`. I think it's more for ease of development and open-sourcing etc. It means it's its own package now although I believe that it's installed as a dependency of tensorflow so for the user there isn't a huge change. You can point your TB issues and suggestions to the team at tensorflow/tensorboard :)
